definitions.definition: the period during which a king, queen, emperor, etc. rules

examples.text: By the end of his reign, the vast empire was in decline.
The house was built during the reign of Henry VIII.

definitions.definition: the period during which somebody is in charge of an organization, a team, etc.

examples.text: Sir Alex Ferguson's reign at Manchester United
The story only came out during the final days of his reign as Chief Executive.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French reignier ‘to reign’, reigne ‘kingdom’, from Latin regnum, related to rex, reg- ‘king’.
